data.title: Fix a possible crash in ResourceLayer
data.body:
Fixes following crash:

```
Tiberian Sun Mod at Version {DEV_VERSION}
on map 88cead46c1e5f57c7a6307bdcd8d27fefe7b805a (Name your map here by Your name here).
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.34209
Exception of type `System.IndexOutOfRangeException`: Index out of bounds. (Der Index war au√üerhalb des Arraybereichs.)
   at OpenRA.CellLayer`1.get_Item(CPos cell) in \OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Map\CellLayer.cs:Line 82.
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.ResourceLayer.GetResource(CPos cell)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.SeedsResource.<Seed>b__4(CPos p)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.<SkipWhileIterator>d__52`1.MoveNext()
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.<CastIterator>d__b1`1.MoveNext()
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.FirstOrDefault[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.SeedsResource.Seed(Actor self)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.SeedsResource.Tick(Actor self)
   at OpenRA.World.<Tick>b__a(TraitPair`1 x) in \OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\World.cs:Line 287.
   at OpenRA.WorldUtils.DoTimed[T](IEnumerable`1 e, Action`1 a, String text) in \OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\WorldUtils.cs:Line 53.
   at OpenRA.World.Tick() in \OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\World.cs:Line 0.
   at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OrderManager orderManager) in \OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:Line 475.
   at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick() in \OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:Line 499.
   at OpenRA.Game.Loop() in \OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:Line 623.
   at OpenRA.Game.Run() in \OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:Line 663.
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args) in \OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:Line 117.
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args) in \OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:Line 39.
```

I'm not sure how I got it, probably due to placing blossom trees near/at the map cordon.

data.title: Fix the sietch being DamagedWithoutFoundation
data.body: Fixes #9517.

data.title: Rename TileShape to fit its role better
data.body:
This is the second small step toward "diamond" maps.
It just does some renaming to enable the addition of an _Isometric_ grid type.
Also `TileShape` isn't exactly proper, as it's used for much more than that.

data.title: Resources growing/spreading logic should be configurable seperatly from each other
Resources should be able to grow/spread without a Blossom Tree
data.body:
In TS, even loose Tiberium patches were able to grow/increase in density and spread to nearby cells over time. Currently in OpenRA, this only works when a Blossom Tree is present.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27144007-resources-should-be-able-to-grow-spread-without-a-blossom-tree?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fix TS component towers
data.body:
As the commit message suggests, `WithWallSpriteBody` was hijacking `WithSpriteBody`'s `DefaultAnimation` before/during the "make" animation, and the `Building` trait is counting on the make animation to finish and notify it that the building is complete. But that never happens, so the building is "stuck" with `Building.BuildComplete == false`, which then causes all sorts of trouble.

Fixes #9428.

data.title: WithVoxelTurret offset isn't working properly
data.body:
Clearly visible in TS on Nod laser turret. Last I checked the Tick Tank and artillery had the same issue on `WithVoxelBarrel`.
(Actually `WithVoxelTurret` doesn't have its own offset, so it uses the offset from `Turreted`.)
Testing with the laser turret, it appears the Z component of the offset vector only affects where the turret's shadow is rendered, but doesn't affect the turret itself.

data.title: Implement actor-producing support powers
data.body: Implements the original spawning for fremen and saboteur in d2k, and the hunter-seeker spawning in TS (note: we don't yet support the proper H-S targeting, so it is left as a player-controlled unit).

data.title: Add hotkey configuration for scroll keys
data.body:
This is a resurrected #9148.

No changes except to fix the code style issue.

data.title: D2k cloak sounds
data.body:
Dune 2000 only has a cloak sound on the Saboteur. Fremen and Stealth Raiders don't get cloaks sounds.
And none of the above 3 actors has an uncloak sound.

data.title: Tiberian Sun style right-click-and-drag scrolling implementation
data.body:
Rarr :3

```
This patch introduces support for the right-click-and-drag scrolling that
is available in Tiberian Sun and Red Alert 2. It can be enabled by
selecting "TS" scrolling in the Input settings.

A side-effect of this is that events previously tied to right clicks on
the world are now based on the release of the click rather than the press.

"Middle-Mouse Scrolling:" in the menu is also changed to "Scrolling Method:"
```

data.title: Fremen sietch should not spawn at half health
data.body: The sietch is spawned with half health ingame, which is weird. I guess it inherits `^Building`, but doesn't remove the `DamagedWithoutFoundation` trait.

data.title: D2k grenadier idle animation looks wrong
data.body:
The white line above his head is the weapon offset, shown by the combat debug overlay (the offset is wrong, but ignore that for the moment).
The issue is that he is facing one way, while the animation seems to be facing the other.

![](http://i.imgur.com/fc61q40.png)  ![](http://i.imgur.com/exm9sSS.png)

data.title: In-game map editor does not remember the location of the map loaded.
data.body:
As of now, the in-game map editor - in the "Save Map"-window - does revert the "directory" back to the first entry (which is /mods/ra/maps - the "official" folder), regardles of from which directory it was loaded.

This results in having to change the directory everytime you save your progress on the map.

It should remember/re-set the "directory" to the location from where the file was loaded, to prevent ppl thinking that their progress was not saved / and this also prevents accidential doubles of maps inside your folders.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27117077-in-game-map-editor-does-not-remember-the-location-of-the-map-loaded?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: TD Additional Balance Changes Revamped
data.body:
Forums link: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&p=292265#292265

Infantry stealth detection: Increase sight range of stealth detection to
2 from 1.

MLRS: Reduce price to 1000 from 1200

Repair pad: Power remains at 30. Repair speed increased. (Interval 15
from 0)

Blue Tiberium: Reduce the value income to 75-90% from 110% (60 from 75)

Infantry evade chance: 75 from 67

Samsites: cost reduced to 700 from 750. Reduced build time (2000 from
2160)

Airstrikes: Increase cool down timer to 3:30 from 3:00.

---

From the old messy pull request which is closed/deleted. Updated with cleaner slate and less mistakes. Updated additions. Finalized.

https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9454

data.title: Makes hide-map and reveal-map crates affect allied players.
data.body: This way, allied players will have the same shroud visibility.

data.title: Infantry sometimes do not attack-move when on Defend stance
data.body: My rocket soldiers often do this in engagements when tanks get out of range. After they find a target after the a-move, they do not attack their target once it comes out of range. This did not happen in the previous release.

data.title: Multiple units commanded to service depot causes stuck units
data.body:
Sometimes if several units are commanded to be repaired at a single Service Depot, if a rally point is set to a location parallel to a unit that is sitting next to the Service Depot, the unit that has been recently repaired will be stuck at the Service Depot. Although this can be fixed by a simple micro of the unit to another direction, players may not notice it before it is too late.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27096567-multiple-units-commanded-to-service-depot-causes-stuck-units?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Yaks/Migs do a 360¬∞ spin when commanded to land at an airfield
data.body: I deal with this several times in my games, but this is very much a minor issue since I can always command them to go near an airfield first, then ask them to land. Otherwise, they may be near AA guns or SAM sites and the 360¬∞ turn causes them to come too close.

data.title: Add DeployStateInit for Pre-deployment and Clean Up after #9124
data.body:
Allows map makers to put deployed actors by adding `DeployState: Deployed` in `map.yaml` for the actor.
Includes a clean up after #9124 (closes #9497), because there is an unnecessary `StartSequence` for `WithSpriteBody@deployed` under `LPST`.

data.title: Consistent 'deploy' ability across all units
data.body:
I just found out that minelayers can deploy mines automatically using 'ctrl'. Similarly phase tanks use 'shift' to blink. All other units use F to deploy.

As these are special abilities for these units, it would make for better usability if all these units could use the same deploy key. I also think these units would see much more use as these keys do not seem to be documented anywhere?
